Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

Sureï¼ŒI've checked in demo code. The path elements for SVG are in DOM tree indeed, which introduce some performance issue. I am not sure how much performance we can promote by not render path for 'none' symbol or symbol with 0 opacity.
Maybe there are some reason we keep the paths as placeholder? @Ovilia

I tried with `handleColor` which works with v4.6.0.

```
    dataZoom: [
          {
            type: 'inside',
            realtime: true,
            rangeMode: 'value',
            startValue: 1,
            endValue: 10
          },
          {
            show: true,
            realtime: true,
            rangeMode: 'value',
            startValue: 1,
            endValue: 10,
            fillerColor: '#ff0000',
            handleColor: '#990000'
          }
        ]
```

This issue is not created using [issue template](https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-issue-helper/) so I'm going to close it. ğŸ™Š
Sorry for this, but it helps save our maintainers' time so that more developers get helped.
Feel free to create another issue using the issue template.

If you think you have already made your point clear without the template, or your problem cannot be covered by it, you may re-open this issue again.

@yanheSu 
We also have external filters like 3m, 6m, 1y, YTD to zoom accordingly. If we use time axis then we can give startValue date according to filter. If we use category axis then we need to iterate through data to find what is next available point and give start value accordingly. Is there any easier way (That is my main purpose of using time axis than category).

@alex2wong Still doesn't solve my problem. It only displays on hover of donut section & It changes based on section. My requirement is doing some calculation based on data & put final number with some text at the center of donut like i displayed in  image in my question.
Hi @telco2011 . Could you give more information about why not using tree chart type?
This issue is labeled with `priority: high`, which means it's a frequently asked problem and we will fix it ASAP.
Thanks for reporting. This is probably a bug.
Thanks for reporting. This is a bug.

Hi. ECharts uses Canvas and SVG to render the chart so it's not possible to use CSS to custom all options. But we do support CSS for the tooltip because it's an HTML DOM. Please check [the tooltip doc](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.extraCssText).
We are going to enhance the axis label for the next major release, which we have not yet started.
@jtc23 Please provide a demo for the issue either with https://jsfiddle.net/ovilia/n6xc4df3/ or https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html.

@trannamquan Please provide a demo for the issue either with https://jsfiddle.net/ovilia/n6xc4df3/ or https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html.
What kind of custom function do you need? In your given example, the type should probably be `log`.
https://github.com/lzxue/echartsLayer This is a third-party library that may help. We cannot offer more help here. If you have further questions, please consider asking for help in that repo.
https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=area-stack This is an example of stacking line charts. For bar charts, it's almost the same, only that the series type should be `bar`.

@akvaliya If you wish the text is shown all the time without mouse interaction, then you should probably use [title](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#title) or [graphic.text](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-text.type) to display the information. Note that the `title` could be an array for multiple text.

@sikazhang Your demo uses ECharts 4.4.0 and it works fine with @dimunidze 's demo, which uses ECharts 4.6.0. So this is probably a bug raised after 4.4.0.

@dimunidze It depends on the community contributors. If it's urgent, you may consider trying debugging yourself.

@alex2wong I'm not sure what you mean by *placeholder*.
I think one way to fix this is to not add the element to the container if it's none. This is not an SVG problem because Canvas should also not render it.

Hi @Ovilia, thanks for your answer. 

I give you more information about why I want this feature.

I want to show a network topology tree that has nodes with different levels in a hierarchy way, like a tree. To do this, I am using a graph DB ([ArangoDB](https://www.arangodb.com/)) to store the data. This DB, like other graphs DBs, stores the data into nodes and links structure, similar to Echarts graph data structure. I want to continue using this data structure instead of parsing the data and creates a new one following the parent -> children structure that the tree chart type requires. I think it is extra logic that is not necessary and even it could have better performance if Echarts has this layout instead of calculating the node coordinates by myself.

The library (vis.js), that I have told above, has this feature to configure the graph in a hierarchy layout and even it has the possibility to configure the space between nodes, either horizontal and vertical.

It would be awesome if Echarts had similar features for its graph chart type as well.

Thanks @Ovilia. I remove the `"position": "inside", ` and works fine.

@dimunidze try adding `"clip": false` like this: 
```
"type": "bar",
"stack": "defaultStack",
"clip": false,            
"data": [0, 0, 0],
...
```
Does that produce the output you expect?  You'll notice in @sikazhang example, if you enter [0,0,0], the bar is not shown.  This was introduced on [4.4.0-rc.1](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/commit/3c78e9681e8da1b5402c8f5178f6930808b2961b) and documented [here](https://www.echartsjs.com/en/option.html#series-bar.clip).
Ok, thank you
Any news on this feature ?

A few examples at:

* http://bl.ocks.org/z-m-k/5014368 (no license)
* https://plot.ly/javascript/violin/
* https://github.com/datavisyn/chartjs-chart-box-and-violin-plot

Would this be better as a module or within the main library?

ECharts have many chart types now and we are more cautious when considering adding new chart types because it adds to the package size and we need to consider if this chart type is frequently used enough.

For your case, I'd suggest implementing it using the custom series mechanism by yourself.
The document is https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom . The examples and API documents should be enough for you to create by yourself, but you do need spend some time to understand it.
If you think there are some extra API needed when you use the custom series, do let me know.
